title: Cement consumption volume in India 2008 to 2019
summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fiscal Annually, and Consumption in million metric tons in each Fiscal Annually on the y axis.
The maximum Consumption in million metric tons 328.0 is found at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and the minimum is found at FY 2011 where Fiscal Annually is 166.0.
There is a difference of 162.0 between the maximum Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and minimum Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumption in million metric tons for 11 number of Fiscal Annuallys.
The Consumption in million metric tons is highest at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and lowest at Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fiscal Annually, and Consumption in million metric tons in each Fiscal Annually on the y axis.
The maximum Consumption in million metric tons 328.0 is found at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and the minimum is found at FY 2011 where Fiscal Annually is 166.0.
There is a difference of 162.0 between the maximum Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and minimum Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Annually in the x axis and Consumption in million metric tons in the y axis.
The Consumption in million metric tons is appeared to be the highest at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and lowest at Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
There is a difference of 162.0 between the maximum Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and minimum Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
Consumption in million metric tons at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 is 328.0 , second place is FY 2017 at 272.0, and thirdly is FY 2016 at 269.0.
Fiscal Annually FY 2018, and FY 2016 share the same value 269.0.
Considered together, the average Consumption in million metric tons in all 11 Fiscal Annuallys is roughly 242.18.
The Consumption in million metric tons is 2664.0 if we add up values of all Fiscal Annuallys.
